>
 im in bronze 4 but my goal next year is Gold, how can i win ranked???

Kill the nexus

Since it's the pre-season a lot of things will have changed since you last played, no doubt. Get used to the new items, masteries and objective priorities. Lanes snowball much harder now, with jungle having a greater impact on the game - a fed top lane can single-handedly take the top inhib. in the first 15 minutes (towers are paper, xp advantages are greater due to fewer TP summoners and new game coding.)

You can carry bronze games by yourself. Focus on your own mechanics and gameplay. Beat your counterpart and use the lead to snowball from there. Use your team's CC, high damage champions when you roam to heighten your chances of kills.

Bronze is pure solo q.

http://www.lol-coaching.com/
It's a website with coaches that will help you, most of them are free but there are a few that charge. It gives you their main role and champions, it has a built in messenger to talk to your coach before your session. I think they recently started a thing called Adopt-A-Newbie, you can get matched with a Coach and they will help you over time, not just over one session. I have a friend that tried it.
be confident. always have the mindset of u being better than whoever u're vsing

Rocka has the right idea, I'll just elaborate on it a bit. It's really good to analyse everything you do, because at our level there's so many things going wrong, which means we can often learn a lot. Use sites like:

http://www.replay.gg/
http://oce.op.gg/
http://www.lolking.net/champions

Use replay.gg to review your losses and see what went wrong. op.gg is great for seeing who's going to be a threat on the enemy team before the match starts, and lolking will help you see what champions are most effective ATM.

Analysis is the most important one so don't slack on it if you can. Also analysing pro-games can also be really good.

Lastly find some educational League youtubers and watch their streams/videos. Make sure it's actually educational, dunkey, keyori and uberdanger are not educational. You should be following people like gbay99, foxdrop, Redmercy and bjergsen.
Yes, i will certainly be sure to check those sites out. Thank you for taking ur time to help xD
